meanings.definition: Inability to be satisfied or appeased
meanings.sent1: Her insatiability for knowledge led her to read every book in the library.
meanings.sent2: The insatiability of his hunger drove him to eat three burgers in one sitting.
meanings.sent3: His insatiability for dessert was so extreme that he ate all the cookies in one go.
meanings.sent4: The insatiability of the fire consumed everything in its path, leaving only ashes behind.
meanings.sent5: The insatiability of the toddler's curiosity knew no bounds as he asked 'why' to every answer given.

meanings.definition: Greediness or avarice that cannot be fulfilled
meanings.sent1: The insatiability of the king's desire for power led to the downfall of his kingdom.
meanings.sent2: Her insatiability for new shoes meant she bought a pair every week.
meanings.sent3: The insatiability of the squirrel for nuts was so extreme that it hoarded them all in its nest.
meanings.sent4: The insatiability of his ambition drove him to take risks others wouldn't dare.
meanings.sent5: The insatiability of the collector's passion for rare stamps knew no limits as he searched the world for new additions.
